poem:
Title: "Gift of the Quiet Morning"

Oh, to wake up in a morning hum,
Eliza's world suddenly struck dumb.
Day by day, as our world did ache,
in silence a solitary journey she'd make.

An expected flight, a bride's bouquet,
replaced with an eerie silence that day.
In the city that sings, can there still be charm,
when you can't hear the alarm?
